title: Grwyne Fawr Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Gareth James / Grwyne Fawr reservoir dam
images.caption: Grwyne Fawr reservoir dam

images.title: Philip Halling / Grwyne Fawr Reservoir
images.caption: Reservoir viewed from the moorland above

images.title: Graham Horn / Above Grwyne Fawr reservoir
images.caption: Looking down from the north-eastern corner of the square on the Twyn Talcefyn ridge. Up here its all tussocky moorland grass.

images.title: Martin Wilson / Grwyne Fawr Reservoir dam
images.caption: Below the snowy NE flanks of Waun Fach, the reservoir is completely full: water is emerging through the spillway arches and running down the dam face.

description: This is a lovely waterside walk along the Grwyne Fawr to Grwyne Fawr Reservoir in the Brecon Beacons. You can start your walk from the Mynydd Du car park and follow the trails north to the reservoir. The rushing waters and the beautiful scenery of the Vale of Grwyney are a real delight. The route climbs to a height of over 1800ft so is quite challenging. You are rewarded with splendid views over the surrounding hillls of the Black Mountains. To extend your walk you could further explore the Mynydd Du Forest with its miles of walking trails and mountain bike tracks to try. Just to the west of the lake you can pick up the Dragons Back circular walk which provides magnificent views over the area. Also nearby is Waun Fach the highest mountain in the Black Mountains. The climb to Mynydd Troed and Cockit Hill from Pengenffordd is also located in this area.
